qa.question: What is a virtual data centre?
qa.answer: A Virtual Data Centre is an abstraction of a physical data centre. It offers the same infrastructureÂ (network, storage and compute) in a virtualised environment; it offers Infrastructure as a Service. The infrastructure is available on demand, highly scalable and you only pay for what you use.

answer.para: Interoute's VDC gives you complete control over the management of your virtual machines and data. You can perform data management in the VDC Control Centre: there are functions to create snapshots of virtual machines or storage volumes, which can be used as backups.
